results.snippet: Margery Ann Tabankin, former president of the National Student Association, has been appointed director of the Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA) program, it was announced yesterday. The 29-year-old Miss Tabankin was chosen by Sam Brown,...
results.lead_paragraph: Margery Ann Tabankin, former president of the National Student Association, has been appointed director of the Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA) program, it was announced yesterday. The 29-year-old Miss Tabankin was chosen by Sam Brown, director of ACTION, under which VISTA operates, for the job, which is to run the parent agency's education programs and oversee the work of 3,900 VISTA volunteers in poverty programs.

results.snippet: LAURENT MICHAELMAS is the best-known TV personality of his day, which is some time in 1999. He is also, with the aid of an almost om  niscient and omnipotent compute named Domino, the ultimate political fixer. Unbeknownst to the rest of the world, he...
results.lead_paragraph: LAURENT MICHAELMAS is the best-known TV personality of his day, which is some time in 1999. He is also, with the aid of an almost om niscient and omnipotent compute named Domino, the ultimate political fixer. Unbeknownst to the rest of the world, he is benignly manipulating history, pulling strings to trip up the greedy and the powerful, and nudging nations back from the brink.

results.abstract: co repts sharp drop in net income, to $3.2-million from $19.3-million and discloses unusual pact with union employees whereby 3.5% of their wages are to be deducted and put in fund to insure carrier 2% annual profit on gross revenues; funds will be refunded to employees if profits reach target level, and employees will stand to gain up to 3.5% above their wages if annual profit exceeds 2%; chmn Frank Borman comments (S)
results.snippet: Eastern Air Lines, reporting yesterday a sharp drop in net income, to $3.2 million from $19.3 million, also disclosed an unusual pact with union employees whereby 3.5 percent of their wages are to be deducted and put in a fund to insure the carrier a...
results.lead_paragraph: Eastern Air Lines, reporting yesterday a sharp drop in net income, to $3.2 million from $19.3 million, also disclosed an unusual pact with union employees whereby 3.5 percent of their wages are to be deducted and put in a fund to insure the carrier a 2 percent annual profit on gross revenues.
